title: Why Even Play Anymore?
body:
Punished for winning games, punished for losing games, punished for voicing opinions. 
Win a game, matchmaking gives you apes next game. 
Lose games because of this, demote in ranked play. 
NO matter how you preform, win and lose is only thing that matters to MMR, cant keep it up when you lose because matchmaking gives you people 4 tiers below you. 
Even Faker has complained and called it out on its bullshit. 
Why even play the game. I'm done, this game is done. It is just not fun anymore, it will never be fun. All you see anymore is everybody running the same runes, same 20-25 champs out of the 100+ to choose from. Same strategys, same attitudes. Nothing can fix this game at this point, they ruin it constantly, buffing what doesn't need to.

Why even play anymore? Because it's still fun for me.
If you're a ranked player, give yourself a break, and go play some normals or arams, they're relaxing. Ranked will always be spammed with the best champions, because people play it for win. No matter how Riot will buff and nerf people, FotM champions will still exist, and dominate rankeds.

Game as a core is still really fun for me (unless im laning vs a teemo as a melee ;_;). Winning is fun. But losing with giving your all is fun too! Improving is fun, picking new things is fun, creating new strategies is fun. I recommend you OP, instead of spamming rankeds only (idk if you're doing that) mix them with normals, and test things on normals, try to do something fresh, just have fun!

I hate that this is considered an unpopular opinion. It's what the majority of players have, since people are clearly still playing and enjoying league of legends. I spend most of my league-related time enjoying the video game, not whining on the boards, and I think it's pretty obvious why this opinion is less represented on the boards and on Reddit-- because the people who like the game are playing it. I've been playing this game for four years and it is absolutely the best it has been since Season Four, when I started playing. 

People are talking about random, stupid changes in recent patches, but does anybody remember the laser turrets? Or about how tier2 turrets gave shields? Or any other of the numerous ultimately temporary blunders Riot has put into the game? Riot doing something silly every now and then isn't new, and I really don't mind. Some of the changes-- like rift scuttler-- end up being really innovative and interesting. I wish people would give Riot a chance.

I would agree with you except that at every step the changes did something interesting that had some sort of impact but did not profoundly change the game 100% of the time. Lately every change has a huge impact. Also many of the older changes had some sort of counterplay involved to them. This meta of one-shots does not allow counterplay.

The reason I don't enjoy playing is because I don't have all my favorite champs, my favorite skins in a game where skins cost something up to $20 or so, my emotes, ward skins, chromas, etc. Hours to days to weeks of gameplay gathered over the course of years since season 3 up to season 7. It's a little odd you bring up how matchmaking gives you people 4 tiers for you. But, coincidentally, it just so happens that this would imply the enemy team suffers from the same issue because the game itself doesn't revolve around YOUR MMR in particular. Why is it that YOU complain about matchmaking, when the enemy team deals with the same matchmaking algorithm? It's a matter of perspective. 

You can perform at your best, and others at their worst, but winning and losing is what determines rank in every single game whether you like it or not...and that's the reality of it. The way riot sees it is "You aren't fit to climb because you weren't able to carry your team", because the assumption is: "If I'm fed and my team is underperforming, then I should be able to use my lead to get my team ahead". You don't have to agree with the logistics here, but a lot of pros play on smurf accounts, which means that they're bound to be playing with an under performing team, yet somehow they still manage to carry the game.
